headline: Salivary Gland-Enriched Expression with Circadian Regulation and Developmental Upregulation
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits highly tissue-specific expression in Anopheles gambiae, with over 50-fold enrichment in salivary glands compared to midgut and substantial expression in chemosensory organs (maxillary palps >> antennae) and immune cells (hemocytes). The gene shows clear circadian rhythmicity with peak expression at subjective midnight and developmental upregulation during late larval stages and embryogenesis. Expression responds dynamically to
  • environmental stresses (heat shock, ivermectin treatment)
  • pathogen infections (differential patterns with Plasmodium and Wolbachia)
  • reproductive processes (blood feeding, hormonal stimulation)
. The pronounced salivary gland enrichment combined with stress responsiveness suggests potential roles in vector biology, possibly related to blood feeding, pathogen transmission, or host-seeking behaviors.

topics.headline: Strong Tissue-Specific Expression Patterns with Salivary Gland and Chemosensory Enrichment
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows highly tissue-specific expression with over 50-fold enrichment in salivary glands versus midgut, 8-fold higher expression in maxillary palps versus antennae, and preferential expression in hemocytes and fat body tissues.

topics.headline: Developmental Upregulation During Larval Stages and Embryogenesis
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression increases progressively during larval development with peak levels at 192 hours, shows upregulation during late embryogenesis (43-49h), and maintains high expression in adults while being minimal in pupae.

topics.headline: Circadian Rhythmicity with Nighttime Expression Peak
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene exhibits robust circadian oscillations with peak expression around CT12 (subjective midnight) in both heads and bodies, maintaining rhythmicity under constant darkness conditions.

topics.headline: Dynamic Response to Environmental Stresses and Drug Treatments
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression responds strongly to heat shock (with chromosomal inversion-dependent differences) and shows 3-6 fold upregulation following ivermectin treatment at multiple time points.

topics.headline: Pathogen and Symbiont Infection-Dependent Expression Changes
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows dramatically higher expression in salivary glands versus midguts during Plasmodium falciparum infection and exhibits strain-specific responses to different Wolbachia infections in mosquito cell lines.

topics.headline: Blood Feeding and Reproductive Hormone Responses
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression peaks at 3 hours post-blood feeding followed by progressive decline, and shows significant upregulation in female reproductive tract tissues following 20-hydroxyecdysone injection.

topics.headline: Association with Insecticide Resistance Phenotypes
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene is upregulated in bendiocarb-resistant mosquitoes but shows higher expression in deltamethrin-susceptible individuals, indicating complex relationships with different insecticide resistance mechanisms.
